instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.SMC_ADPAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADPAPTER_EN? This is a typo of SMC_ADAPTER_EN When you see SMC_ADPAPTER_EN, assume they meant to type SMC_ADAPTER_EN.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message:
[FONT=lucida sans unicode]Hello!

got this board that worked fine yesterday and now appears dead. I've got green light in the charger, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.54V, all main s5 rails are good. I did a visual inspection, no liquid damage but caps <CAPACITOR>C1680</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C1681</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C1682</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1683</CAPACITOR> did not look right, as if the metal part on each side was detaching from the body. I measured all four in beep mode and they are all short circuited!

Should I replace the capacitors and go from there or is the CPU blown and itâ€™s a waste of time?[/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Pretty sure there will be nothing wrong with those caps. Why did this board come to you, was this liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: One day was working fine, next day did not boot. No liquid damage visible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Check if there is a pulse(s) of power on L7260 when connecting the power.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: I have no oscilloscope, when measuring with FLUKE on voltage mode I get no reaction when connecting the power

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Multimeter may be to slow to catch the pulse so this proves nothing. Check <SIGNAL>SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for pulse. Did you check all rails for short to GND?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Went to a friend who has a professional oscilloscope, measured on L7260, no pulse :( Is the board dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> on chip <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> pin 8 is 3.459V. <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.305V pin 2 3.209V,  <RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.305V pin 2 3.030V, <RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.305V pin2 3.299V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Resistance to GND on L7260? Missing voltages on <RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR>? <SIGNAL>SMC_ADPAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Resistance to GND on L7260 pin1 1.047V, pin2 0.447V, <RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR> pin1 3.304V pin 2 3.298, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADPAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q7920</TRANSISTOR> pin 2 is 3.439V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message:
Resistance to GND on L7260 pin1 1.047V, pin2 0.447V
typo i gues?
no charger/battery when measuring resistance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: Measured again although I did not have the board connected to power source. L7260 pin 1   .446 pin 2   .446. I operate with a FLUKE 17B+ and in diode mode there is a small V next to the reading, that's why I wrote 1.047V before, sorry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: no problem just wanted to make sure,

threads.message: Out of ideas on this one, sorry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: How do we test if it's the SMC chip or not?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light OK, no boot, no chime
threads.message: You replace it with another one. Very much doubt it will help unless there was corrosion under it.
